newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Central West Media shares suspended.
newsitem.headline: Central West Media shares suspended.

text.p: Shares in Central West Media Ltd were suspended from official quotation at the company's request, effective immediately, the Australian Stock Exchange said on Thursday.
Earlier on Thursday, the ASX imposed a trading halt.
Central West Media said it requested that the suspension to allow its directors time to consider various proposals received by the company.
"Acceptance of these proposals would see the company undertaking a change in direction," it said.

"The suspension will continue until such time as the proposals are rejected, or if any of the proposals are accepted, until such time as shareholders have been fully informed of the company's change in direction, and if necessary, the company has obtained all shareholder approvals and complied with any other requirements of Australian Stock Exchange Ltd in relation to reinstatement of the company's securities to quotation," it added.
Central West shares last traded at A$1.50 on June 3.
